pages.text: The Rune of Unleashed Nature is a hybrid altar component that channels Botania's mana into Blood Magic's altar system. Unlike the Arcane Rune which requires Source, this rune draws from an internal mana buffer that can be refilled by any Botania mana-transferring mechanism.
Crafted using a $(item)Blank Rune$() surrounded by Botania's $(item)Livingwood$() and $(item)Manasteel$(). This creates a living altar rune that responds to mana flow.

$(animus)Mana-Powered Rune$()$(br2)This rune functions as a small $(item)Mana Pool$() that can be placed in your Blood Altar structure. It stores up to 10,000 mana internally and provides bonuses based on its charge level.

pages.title: Passive Bonuses
pages.text: The Rune of Unleashed Nature provides bonuses even when empty:$(br2)$(blood)Always Active:$()$(li)Capacity Bonus: Provides 135%% of a Capacity Rune's effect$(li)Orb Bonus: Provides 67.5%% of a Rune of the Orb's effect, increasing Soul Network storage$(br2)These passive bonuses make it valuable even without mana.

pages.title: Charged Bonus
pages.text: When the rune has mana in its internal buffer:$(br2)$(will)Mana-Powered:$()$(li)Acceleration Bonus: Speeds up altar crafting and LP generation$(li)Consumes 10 mana per second while active$(br2)The acceleration effect stacks with other speed-enhancing runes, making high-tier crafting faster.

pages.title: Charging Methods
pages.text: Since the rune acts as a small Mana Pool, you can charge it using standard Botania methods:$(br2)$(li)$(item)Mana Spreader$(): Point a spreader at the rune to send mana bursts directly to it$(li)$(item)Spark$(): Place a Mana Spark on top of the rune to connect it to your spark network$(br2)The spark method is recommended for altar setups as it allows automatic mana distribution from your main pool.

pages.title: Requirements
pages.text: To use the Rune of Unleashed Nature:$(li)$(animus)Botania must be installed$()$(li)Supply mana via spreaders or sparks$(li)Ensure steady mana generation$(br2)Consider the consumption rate (10 mana/second per rune) when planning your mana infrastructure for multiple runes.
